title: 104_hr851
content: The "Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995" establishes a project. The "Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995" establishes up to 10 pilot projects to investigate the use of rural health care provider telemedicine networks for physician consultative services under Medicare in rural areas. A rural health care provider telemedicine network includes providers in rural areas collaborating with a multispecialty tertiary care provider for patient care and transportation. The Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995 establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in designated rural areas for patient referral, joint communications, and transportation among network members. The network operates in rural health professional shortage areas or underserved rural areas as specified by the Secretary. The Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995 establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in designated rural areas for patient referral, joint communications, and transportation among network members. Medicare payment for participants is addressed in Section 3. The Rural Telemedicine Act of 1995 establishes pilot projects for rural health care provider telemedicine networks in designated rural areas for patient referral, joint communications, and transportation among network members. Under this Act, the Secretary will make payments from the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund for physician services in rural areas, including consultations with medicare beneficiaries. The methodology for determining payment amounts will consider available funds and include payment for signal transmission facilities. Payments may also be made for nonphysician providers. The methodology involves making payments for signal transmission facilities for physician consultative services. Payments can also be made for nonphysician providers. Networks eligible for participation in the pilot project must submit an application to the Secretary and agree to provide necessary information. The term "rural area" is defined in the Act. Criteria for selecting participants are outlined in section 5. In selecting networks for pilot projects, priority is given to those facilitating consultations between patients and specialists through detailed data transmission. Existing networks can also participate. The Secretary must submit an interim report to Congress within 24 months of making payments for pilot project services, detailing participating projects and networks, expenses, and patient numbers. A final report is due within 1 year after project termination, analyzing cost-effectiveness, impact on patient care quality and access, and providing recommendations for changes in the Medicare program related to telemedicine. The Secretary must provide recommendations for changes in the Medicare program related to telemedicine, including cost estimates. Authorization of appropriations from the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund for a total of $51,000,000 for a demonstration project under this Act, with up to $1,000,000 allocated for administrative purposes.
